perturbation.original_text: g. "Endorsed Product(s)" shall only mean and include Company's irons, woods, wedges and putters.
perturbation.changed_text: g. "Endorsed Product(s)" shall only mean and include Company's wedges and putters.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'irons, woods' from the definition of 'Endorsed Product(s)', this creates a contradiction with later sections that discuss North's use of F2 branded irons and woods (e.g., section 6.c). This affects enforcement, as it becomes unclear whether the endorsement agreement truly covers these product categories.

perturbation.original_text: a. Guaranteed Service Fee and Marketing Retainer. In consideration for the rights, services and benefits granted by North hereunder,  Company agrees to pay North a non-refundable Guaranteed Service Fee and Marketing Retainer (hereinafter referred to as "Guaranteed  Fee") of fifty-five thousand dollars ($55,000USD) in Contract Year 2011 and seventy thousand dollars ($70,000USD) in Contract Year  2012.
perturbation.changed_text: a. Guaranteed Service Fee and Marketing Retainer. In consideration for the rights, services and benefits granted by North hereunder,  Company agrees to pay North a non-refundable Guaranteed Service Fee and Marketing Retainer (hereinafter referred to as "Guaranteed  Fee") in Contract Year 2011 and seventy thousand dollars ($70,000USD) in Contract Year  2012.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specific dollar amount for Contract Year 2011, while retaining the reference to 'Guaranteed Fee' for that year in later payment schedules (7.a.i, 7.a.ii, 7.a.iii), introduces a clear contradiction. The fee is mentioned, but its amount is not defined.

perturbation.original_text: b. Royalties. In addition to payments due North by Company as set forth in paragraphs 7.a. above, Company further agrees to pay North  a one percent (1%) royalty on all Gross Revenue generated from the sale of all Company Products (herein "Royalties").
perturbation.changed_text: b. Royalties. In addition to payments due North by Company as set forth in paragraphs 7.a. above, Company further agrees to pay North  a royalty on all Gross Revenue generated from the sale of all Company Products (herein "Royalties").
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specific percentage (1%) for royalties, while continuing to refer to 'Royalties' and the expectation of payment (7.c), creates an internal contradiction. The obligation to pay royalties remains, but the method for calculating them is missing, making it unenforceable.
